titulo: Customize the properties shown on records
conteudo: Properties are displayed on records in the left sidebar when viewing a record, and in the preview sidebar when previewing record details. If user permissions are turned on for a property list card in these sidebars, users can edit the properties that appear on the card. If you have Customize record page layout or Super Admin permissions, you can customize record views for all users and specific teams. Navigate to your records: Contacts: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Contacts . Companies: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Companies . Deals: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Deals . Tickets: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Tickets . Leads (BETA): In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Leads . Appointments (if activated ): In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Appointments . Courses (if activated ): In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Courses . Listings (if activated ): In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Listings . Services (if activated ): In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Services . Custom objects : In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM , then select the custom object . Click the name of the record to view the left sidebar, or hover over the record and click Preview to view the preview sidebar. In the section, click Actions , then select Customize properties . To add properties to the section, click Add properties , then select the checkboxes of properties to add. To remove a property from the section, click delete delete icon . If the icon is greyed out, the property is an account-wide default property that cannot be removed. To reorder properties in the section, click and drag properties to the order you want. To reset the properties in the section to the default, click Reset to system defaults . In the dialog box, click Reset to defaults to confirm. This will reset that section to the account default, but will not update other sections included in a default sidebar. Click Save . Please note: if you previously modified the properties displaying on a card, any new default properties added by your administrator will be added to the bottom of the card. properties CRM records Object Settings

titulo: View and update your Commerce Hub account information
conteudo: The Commerce Hub account overview provides a summary of connected commerce account information for users who have set up HubSpot payments or Stripe as a payment processing option . You can view existing account information, and modify information such as bank account details, and personal details. The account overview lists information such as your account name, the primary point of contact listed for that account, which payment processor you're using, the transaction and platform fees on your account, as well as any promotional or custom fee rates, and your application date. You can add a or modify your bank account details, edit specific account details, such as your URL, your public descriptors, and your personal details. Commerce account overview View your commerce account information To view the commerce account overview: In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Commerce . If using HubSpot payments , you will see: Account overview: An overview of your account including your account name, primary point of contact, payment processing provider, transaction fees, and application date. Account information: Professional details: your website URL and industry. Public details: your descriptor shown on customer statements. Personal details: Your legal name, email address, date of birth, home address, phone number, and social security number. Bank account details: Your bank name and details (e.g., account number, routing number). If using Stripe as a payment processing option , you will see: Account information: Professional details: your website URL and industry. Public details: your descriptor shown on customer statements. Personal details: Your legal name, email address, date of birth, home address, phone number, and social security number. Payout details : your bank name and details (e.g., account number, routing number). Authentication : the email used to authenticate. Update your commerce account information To update your commerce account information: In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Commerce . To update your point of contact: Under Account Overview , click Actions , then select Edit point of contact . In the POC email field, enter the email address of the new point of contact, then click Save . To update your website information: Under Account information , click Edit next to Professional details . Click the Industry dropdown menu and select your industry . In the Your website field, enter your website URL . Click Save . To update your statement descriptor: Under Account information , click Edit next to Public details . In the Statement descriptor field, enter your statement descriptor , then click Save . To update your personal details: Under Account information , click Edit next to Personal details . In the Your legal name fields, enter your first and last names . In the Email address field, enter your email address . In the Date of birth field, enter your date of birth . In the Home address field, enter your address . In the Phone number field, enter your phone number . In the Social security number field, enter your social security number . Click Submit . To update your bank account details: Click Edit next to Bank account details . In the Account holder name field, enter the account holder name . In the Account number field, enter your account number . In the other field, enter your routing number/sort code (depending on the country of your bank account). Disconnect your Stripe account as a payment processor If you choose to disconnect Stripe as your payment processor, please be aware of the following: Customers won't be able to pay any existing payment links, quotes or invoices. All subscriptions will be canceled and payments won't be collected. You won't be able to issue refunds from HubSpot. Refunds will need to be issued from Stripe. Payments data in HubSpot will be read-only. To disconnect your Stripe account: In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Commerce . Click the Actions dropdown menu in the upper right of the Account Overview section, then click Disconnect processor . A dialog box will open, detailing how your HubSpot account will be affected upon disconnection. Click Disconnect Stripe to confirm disconnection. If you would like to set up a new payment processor, you can set up a different Stripe account , or HubSpot payments . Disconnect HubSpot payments ( Starter, Professional or Enterprise only) If you choose to disconnect HubSpot payments, please be aware of the following: Customers won't be able to pay any existing payment links, quotes or invoices. All subscriptions will be canceled and payments won't be collected. You won't be able to issue refunds from HubSpot. Payments and payout data in HubSpot will be read-only. To disconnect HubSpot payments: In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Commerce . Click the Actions dropdown menu in the upper right of the Account Overview section, then click Disconnect processor . A dialog box will open, detailing how your HubSpot account will be affected upon disconnection. Click Start chat support to start the disconnection process. HubSpot support will then walk you through the disconnection process. If you would like to set up a new payment processor, you can set up a Stripe as a payment processor or reconnect HubSpot payments . Payment Processing

titulo: Importar participantes do evento de marketing
conteudo: Com os eventos de marketing, você pode armazenar dados online e offline dos seus clientes para acompanhar, comparar e avaliar os seus eventos como uma estratégia. Abaixo, saiba como criar manualmente um evento de marketing e importar participantes do evento. Você pode importar contatos existentes ou novos para associá-los ao evento. Por exemplo, você tem dez contatos existentes que deseja adicionar como participantes a um evento específico. Você pode importá-los com endereços de e-mail como participantes do evento e reter seus dados existentes porque os endereços de e-mail agem como identificadores exclusivos para evitar duplicações. Criar um e-mail de marketing Para criar um evento de marketing: Na sua conta da HubSpot, navegue até Marketing > Eventos . Na parte superior direita, clique em Criar Evento de marketing . Insira o nome do evento, a descrição, o tipo, as datas de início e término e o organizador. Clique em Criar evento de marketing . Prepare seu arquivo de importação Observe os seguintes requisitos ao configurar seu arquivo de importação: É recomendado um arquivo .csv. Cabeçalhos obrigatórios: E-mail , Participou , Registrado , Cancelado Veja um exemplo de arquivo de importação CSV aqui . Saiba mais sobre as propriedades de formatação de data aqui . Importar participantes do evento Para importar manualmente os participantes do evento de marketing: Na sua conta da HubSpot, navegue até Marketing > Eventos . Clique no evento de marketing ao qual deseja adicionar participantes. No canto superior esquerdo, clique em Ações > Importar contatos do evento . Selecione as atividades que deseja importar: Registrado , Participou ou Cancelou . Carregue o arquivo. Selecione como importar os objetos e o idioma do arquivo  e clique em nº seguinte . Mapeie colunas para propriedades de evento e contato e clique em Próximo . Confirme o nome do seu arquivo de importação. Clique na caixa de seleção para concordar que os contatos esperam receber sua opinião e que o arquivo de importação não inclui uma lista comprada. Saiba mais sobre a política de utilização responsável da HubSpot . Selecione o formato de Data e Fuso horário das propriedades da atividade de evento de marketing. Clique na caixa de seleção se quiser criar contatos de marketing . Clique em Finalizar importação . Quando a importação for concluída, você poderá exibir o número de participantes que se inscreveram, cancelaram e participaram do evento de marketing na página do evento. Clique em cada número para ver os contatos específicos. Integrations

In your conversations inbox availability management settings, you can review your team's availability status and which inboxes they have access to in your account. Users with Availability Management permissions can override an individual user's availability status. To add or remove users from an inbox, navigate to your inbox settings . In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar, navigate to Inbox > Availability Management . There will be a table with a list of users who have access to your inboxes. Use the filters at the top of the table to segment your team by user, status, or inbox. To change a team member's status to offline, click the dropdown menu next to their name and select Away . Please note: if you're a free user, you can view your other team members' status, but can't make changes to another user's status. If a user with Availability Management permissions sets your status to Away , you'll see an alert when you navigate to the inbox. To change your status, in the dialog box, click Set myself to available . Inbox

Subscription types represent the legal basis to communicate with your contacts through email . Contacts can manage their email preferences so they're only opted in to emails they want to receive. If your account has access to marketing contacts , only marketing contacts can be sent marketing emails. Please note: custom subscription types are not available for HubSpot CRM accounts, but if you've turned on data privacy settings in your account you can add Marketing Email or Sales Email subscription types to your contacts manually. Understand subscription preferences and types To check a contact's status for a subscription type: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Contacts . Click the name of a contact. In the Communication subscriptions section on the left side of the contact record, click View subscriptions . In the right panel, review the status for each of your subscription types. The three possible statues for a subscription type are Subscribed , Unsubscribed , or Not specified . Based on whether you have data privacy settings turned on , this status corresponds to an opt-in state that dictates whether you can email them: If you have data privacy settings turned on and enforced, subscription types capture three states to clearly represent a contact's consent to communicate. For each subscription type, contacts may have any of the following three states: Opted in: if a contact is in this state, they have explicitly consented to receive emails from your brand. This corresponds to a Subscribed status for a given subscription type. Not opted in or out (default): a contact in this state has yet to agree whether to receive emails from your brand. This state correspond to a Not specified status for a subscription type. You cannot email a contact in this state without first obtaining explicit consent . Opted out: a contact in this state has unsubscribed from receiving emails from your brand. This state corresponds to an Unsubscribed status for a given subscription type. You cannot email a contact if the status associated with the subscription type of your email is Unsubscribed . If you don't have data privacy settings turned on, a contact's status for a subscription type can have one of the following two states: Opted in or not opted out (default) : a contact may be in this state if they've either subscribed to a given subscription type, or they have yet to agree whether to receive emails from your brand. This state corresponds to both the Subscribed and Not specified statuses for a given subscription type. Please note: if data privacy settings are turned off, you can email contacts if their subscription type is Not specified , but it's highly recommended you obtain explicit consent before emailing them to maintain a healthy email sending reputation. Opted out: a contact in this state has unsubscribed from receiving emails from your brand. This state corresponds to an Unsubscribed status for a given subscription type. You cannot email a contact if the status associated with the email's subscription type is Unsubscribed. Subscription type statuses can be updated manually for an individual, in bulk with a workflow , or via API . Communicate with contacts If you have data privacy settings turned on in your account and selected the Only allow marketing emails to be sent to contacts who have a legal basis to communicate checkbox in your account settings, emails can only be sent to contacts who have an Opted in status. Contacts can opt in to your email subscription types through a form that includes a notice of consent for that subscription type. When you’re manually applying legal basis , you’ll also select a legal basis to communicate. If you need to establish consent with your existing contacts, you can send contacts an email with a link to update their email preferences , or run a permission pass campaign . If you aren't using data privacy tools in your account, emails can be sent to contacts with an Opted in or a Not opted in or out status. Emails will not be delivered to contacts who have opted out of that subscription type. To track which contacts want to subscribe to each of your subscription types, you can use a custom property on a form . Please note: emails that contain a subscription confirmation link will bypass the data privacy enforcement process, and will still be received by contacts who did not explicitly opt in. Apart from the data privacy settings above, if you have access to the marketing contacts functionality , only marketing contacts can be sent marketing emails. Set up a subscription type An email subscription type can be created and managed from your settings: In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, click Marketing > Email . Click the Subscription Types tab. Click Create subscription type . Enter a name and a brief description of how this subscription type will be used. If you have turned on data privacy settings in your account, you can optionally configure your subscription type to clarify to your subscribers how and why you'll be contacting them. Click the Purpose of subscription dropdown menu, then select a purpose for the subscription type. This purpose should broadly align with the nature of the emails you plan on sending to the associated subscribers. Learn more about common subscription types on the HubSpot marketing blog . Click the Method of communication dropdown menu, then select a method for how you plan on contacting subscribers. When a contact reviews your subscription type, the purpose and method of communication will appear first, followed by its name and description. You can confirm how your subscription type will appear under Preview . Click Save . On the Subscription Types tab, click a subscription type and drag and drop it into position to re-order your subscription types. This controls the order that subscription types appear on your subscription preferences page . Please note: If you have international contacts, you can create translations of your email subscription types, which will render based on the browser language of your recipients. Learn more about how to add translations for each of your subscription types in this article . You can create up to 1000 subscription types in your HubSpot account. Edit a subscription type To make changes to a subscription type's information: In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, click Marketing > Email . Click the Subscriptions Types tab. Hover over the type and click Edit . Make changes as needed, then click Save . Please note: if you've turned on data privacy settings , you cannot edit the Purpose of subscription or Method of communication fields for default subscription types, such as the Sales and Services subscription types. Archive a subscription If you no longer need a subscription type, you can archive it: In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Marketing > Email . Click the Subscription Types tab. Hover over the subscription type you want to archive, click Action s , then click Archive . In the dialog box, click Archive subscription type . Please note: if you archive the One to One subscription type but later send a one-to-one email or use the subscription type in another HubSpot tool like a form, sequence, or workflow, HubSpot will automatically unarchive the subscription type and it'll be visible again on your subscription preferences page . Manage contact properties for subscription types Once you've created a new subscription type, a corresponding Opted out of email: [Email Subscription Type] contact property will be created. While the property will be visible on contact records immediately, existing contacts will not have a property value set until one of the following occurs: The contact is merged with another contact. The contact has its email address property changed. The contact explicitly opts-in to or opts-out from that email type. An integration (i.e., public API) explicitly marks the contact as opted-in to or opted-out from that email type. Any changes to the subscription type will update this existing contact property. Renaming a subscription type will cause the corresponding property to be renamed. Marking a subscription type as inactive will cause the corresponding property to be hidden from the contact record, and vice versa. Marketing Email

If multiple users in your HubSpot account are involved in deals , users with Super admin permissions can set up deal splits. When you set up deal splits, you allow users to share percentages of the amount of a deal. The amount received by each user in a deal split affects their forecast . Deal splits are useful for salespeople who have a quotas and need to get credit for all of their impacted revenue. To include users who have worked on a deal, but don't necessarily need credit for the deal amount, you can add them as deal collaborators . Users can be included both in a deal split and as a collaborator for the same deal. Turn on deal splits Users with Super admin permissions can turn on deal splits in the deal settings. In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Objects > Deals . Select the Split deals among users checkbox. In the pop-up box, select Set up deal splits. To set a maximum number of users that can be included in any new deal splits, click the Deal split user maximum dropdown menu and select the number of users. To set a minimum percentage that can be applied to users in a deal split, click the Deal split minimum percentage dropdown menu and select a percentage. Please note: depending on the number of deals in your account, it can take a few minutes or up to a few hours to fully set up deal splits. Add, edit, or remove splits on a deal Once deal splits are turned on in your settings, users with Edit deal permissions can add a split to a deal or edit existing deal splits. To remove deal splits, users must also have Delete deal permissions. In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Deals . Click the deal you want to add a split to. In the left sidebar, in the Deal splits section, click Add . A deal must have a value for the Amount property to add a deal split. In the right panel: Click the Deal split with dropdown menu and select the checkboxes next to the users you want to split the deal amount with. The deal owner will be included by default and can not be removed. Under Deal split type: Select Split evenly to assign an equal percentage of the deal to all selected users. Select Split by percentages to set your own percentages. Enter a percentage number for each user in the Deal split breakdown section until you reach a total of 100%. Click Add deal split. You can now view the users and percentage breakdown on the deal record. To edit an existing deal split, click the box containing the deal split . In the right panel, make your changes, then click Update deal split. To remove an existing deal split, hover over the box and click Remove . In the dialog box, click Remove deal split to confirm. View deal splits in the forecast tool Once a split is added to a deal, you can view the split amount for each user in the forecast tool. In your HubSpot account, navigate to Sales > Forecast . Use the dropdown menus at the top to filter by pipeline or close date . You can also use the search bar to search for specific users and teams. To drill down into a specific user's forecast, click the user's name . If a deal that the user is included on has a split, you can view the user's percentage and the amount they will receive credit for in the table. Split information will be shown for the Amount , Weighted amount , Amount in company currency , and Weighted amount in company currency properties. Use deal splits in custom reports You can also use custom reports to analyze data from your deal splits. For example, you can filter by Deal Split Owner and Deal Split Amount to understand how much credit each user will receive for the deals they are involved in. In your HubSpot account, navigate to Reports > Reports . In the upper right, click Create custom report . In the left sidebar menu, click Custom Report Builder . Click the Primary data source dropdown menu, then select Deal splits . Select Deals as your secondary data source. In the custom report builder, customize your filters . Click Save. To save your report as a copy, click Save as . In the right panel, name and select dashboard and permission settings for the report. Once you're done, click Save . Learn more about creating custom reports in HubSpot. records

After using HubSpot's full-screen social composer to draft your social post, you can create different types of Instagram posts: You can create Instagram reels to share video content. You can create an Instagram carousel and publish multiple images to a single post. You can create and publish Instagram stories to share either image or video content with your followers. Instagram stories will expire after 24 hours. Create an Instagram post, reel, or story To create a new Instagram post, reel, or story: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Social . In the upper right, click Create social post . In the left panel, click the Select accounts dropdown menu. Then, select the checkboxes next to the Instagram account you want to post to. If a default Instagram account has previously been set, it will automatically be selected. To select all connected Instagram accounts, click the Instagram checkbox. Set up your social post draft . The details of the draft post will be duplicated across all social accounts, including the selected Twitter acocunts. At the top, click the Instagram tab. Customize your Instagram post details: What do you want to say in your caption: in the text box, further customize the content for your post. Do note the following: When @mentioning other users in the post, the mentions will not be auto-completed. However, Instagram will acknowledge the mention when the post is live. Instagram does not support links in posts. Add media: add images or a video to your social post. To add another image, in the Add Media section, click the insert image icon . Please note the following: If you're creating a post or reel: You can add up to 10 images to an Instagram carousel post. You cannot add alt text to the images. You can use the following image formats: png, jpg, and jpeg You can use the following video formats: mp4, mov, mpeg4, and mpeg4 When adding a video, it is recommended that each video is less than 1 minute in length If you're creating an Instagram story: Each Instagram story can only include a single image or video. The image or video for your story must meet Instagram's IG User Media requirements . If your image does not meet the suggested 4:5 to 1.91:1 ratio, it may be automatically cropped when published. Publish as: select Post or Reel or Story . All image and carousel posts will be published as regular posts. By default, all single video posts will be published as reels. When creating an Instagram reel, ensure that your video meets Instagram's reel upload requirements and video requirements . Also share to feed (Instagram Reels only): by default, all single video posts will be published as reels. You can choose whether or not the reel displays on your main profile grid: By default, the option to share the reel to your Instagram feed will be turned on. If you do not want to display the reel on your main profile grid, click to toggle the Also share to feed switch off. To duplicate the Instagram post or reel, in the top right, click the add plus icon next to the Instagram account name. This will duplicate the post for the same Instagram account. To delete the Instagram post or reel, click the delete trash icon . After customizing your Instagram posts or reels, in the top right, click Publish now or Schedule . Alternatively, continue editing the posts for other social networks. Tag Instagram posts or reels Tag other Instagram users in your posts or reels to boost post engagement and direct users to relevant pages. You cannot tag stories or videos on carousel posts. To tag users: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Social . In the upper right, click Create social post . Set up your social post draft . At the top, click the Instagram tab. In the Content Type section, click Post or Reel . In Add media section, hover over your image or video , then click the tag icon . Click anywhere on your image or video thumbnail . In the dialog box, enter the account name you want to tag, then click Tag . When entering the account name, do not enter the @ symbol . For example, instead of entering @HubSpot , you can enter HubSpot . Only public Instagram profiles can be tagged. You can add a maximum of 20 tags to each photo or reel. After adding your tags, click Save . Continue setting up your Instagram post . Analyze your Instagram reels Data from your Instagram reels will be included in the social reports available in the Analyze tab. Learn more about the different social reports available . If you've just connected your Instagram account to HubSpot , the last 60 days of social post data including reels data will be automatically retrieved. If your Instagram account is already connected, the last 31 days of social post data including reels data will be automatically retrieved. You can also analyze the performance of reels from the Manage tab of the social tool: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Social . In the top right, click Manage columns . In the dialog box, click the checkboxes next to the metrics that you'd like to include. When analyzing the performance of reels, it is recommended to include the Reach metric. This metric is calculated by the number of unique accounts that have seen your Facebook or Instagram post at least once At the bottom, click Save . You can then review and compare the performance of your reels. You can also export your post data including the new Reach metric. Review your Instagram story performance After publishing your Instagram story, you can specific metrics such as comments, exists, tap forward, and tap backwards. Data from your Instagram stories will also be included in the social reports available in the Analyze tab. Learn more about the different social reports available . Please note: when reviewing your Instagram story, it must have more than 5 interactions to display any metrics. If metrics are available, they will only appear after 25 hours. To review your Instagram story's performance: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Social . In the Manage tab, click your Instagram story . In the right panel, review your Instagram story metrics: Comments: the number of comments on your Instagram story. Exits: the number of times a user has swiped out of the Instagram story. Tap forward: the number of times a user has tapped on the right to move to the next story. Tap backwards: the number of times a user has tapped on the left to review to the previous story. Social

Set up your data privacy request page where contacts can submit requests related to their personal data, such as data access and deletions. For any requests made outside of the page, you can manually create data privacy requests for contacts. If you have a Marketing Hub or Content Hub Professional or Enterprise subscription, you can also add download or delete data modules to your subscription page for your customers to request data access and deletions. By default, all requests from contacts with enriched data will be received, this setting cannot be changed. You can review the status of all requests in the data privacy request manager. Please note: while HubSpot provides this feature, your legal team is the best resource to give you compliance advice for your specific situation. Set up a data privacy request page Configure and publish a data privacy request page for contacts who visit your website to request actions related to their personal data. In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, in the Account Management section, select Privacy & Consent . On the Setup tab, in the left sidebar menu, click Privacy tools . In the Data privacy request page section, click Configure . . In the data privacy request page editor, you can select the data request options that you'd like to offer your contacts: To allow contacts to request the permanent deletion of their personal data, click to toggle the Delete contact data switch on. To allow contacts to request a copy of their data, click to toggle the Export contact data switch on. To add a country field, click to toggle the Country switch on. To turn on CAPTCHA for your request page, click to toggle the ReCAPTCHA switch on. CAPTCHA adds a step to verify that a visitor isn't a robot, before they can submit the request. HubSpot uses reCAPTCHA v2 for spam prevention. In the Business email field, enter an email address . This is a required field. The email address will be used in the verification email sent to users, to ask questions about data privacy. After setting up your page, in the top right, click Publish page . Manage your data privacy request page After creating your data privacy request page, you can share the page directly or set up a URL redirect to use your own domain. You can also update your data request options or unpublish the page. In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, select Privacy & Consent . On the Setup tab, in the left sidebar menu, click Privacy tools . To update an existing data privacy request page, click Edit . To unpublish an existing data privacy request page, click Unpublish page . Then, click Unpublish . Manage data privacy requests After publishing your data privacy request page, review and manage data privacy requests from the data request manager. You can also manually create data privacy requests for contacts who have made requests without using the form, such as in-person or on a call. Then, complete requests by exporting contact data or permanently deleting a contact . In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the top navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, select Privacy & Consent . At the top, click the Data Request Manager tab. On the Data privacy request manager page, you can navigate to different views or create a custom view. Learn how to create and manage saved views . In each view, you can use the dropdown menus at the top to filter your data requests. To review a specific contact, click the contact's name . To take action on the request directly, hover over the request . Then, click Actions and select Delete enriched data , Delete contact data , or Export contact data . To mark a request as complete, hover over the request . Then, click Actions and select Mark as completed . To assign or reassign an owner to the request: Hover over the owner column in the request. Then, click Assign or Reassign . In the dialog box, click the Owner dropdown menu and select a HubSpot user . Then, click Assign or Reassign . Data privacy requests can only be assigned to super admins. ` To manually create a data request, in the top right of the table, click Create new request . In the right panel, set up your data request: Select contact: the contact that you'd like to create the request for. Request type: the data request type. You can select from Data deletion, Data export , and Enriched data deletion. Request Date: the date that the data request should be completed by. Owner: the user assigned to this data privacy request. At the bottom, click Create new request . GDPR Privacy & Consent

After creating a form and adding form fields, you can customize the form fields and form field options. If you haven't added any form fields yet, learn how you can add existing form fields or create a new form field . Please note: it’s recommended to use the updated form editor to create and manage forms. This article should be used as a reference for existing forms built with the legacy editor only. Learn more about editing form fields in the updated form editor . Customize form field options By default, all values in a contact property are available as form field options. However, you can customize the available field options on an individual form basis. In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Lead Capture > Forms . Hover over the form name and click Actions , then select Edit . Or, create a new form . In the form editor, click a field to customize its options. In the left panel, in the Field options section: To remove current options, hover over the option and click Remove . To add unused options, click Add options at the bottom of the section. In the dialog box, select the options to add and click Add . In the top right, click Publish to update the live form. Add new options to a form field In order to add new options to a multiple checkbox, radio select, or dropdown select form field, you must edit the original contact property. Doing this can update the field for all forms using this property. In your HubSpot account, click the settings settings icon in the main navigation bar. In the left sidebar menu, navigate to Properties . Locate and click the name of the property. Ensure that the In forms switch is toggled on for all the options you want to display in your forms. To add a new property option, click + Add an option . Enter a label for your new option. In the bottom left, click Save . You can repeat the above steps for any additional property options you want to add. Your new property options will appear in the form editor and on the live form. Customize your date field After adding a date field to your form, you can choose the type of date format visitors will use in the form field. For example, DD/MM/YYYY or MM-DD-YYYY . In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Lead Capture > Forms . Hover over the form name and click Actions , then select Edit . Hover over the date field and click edit Edit . In the left panel, scroll down and click the Date format dropdown menu, then select your desired date format . In the top right, click Publish . Customize your file upload field After adding a file upload field to your form, you can allow visitors to upload one or more files with their form submissions. When a visitor uploads a file and submits your form, the file is stored in a hidden folder in your file manager. A link to the file will appear in the contact's record in HubSpot. Any uploaded file links will be included in the form submission's data and in the form submission events on the individual contact's timeline. To customize your file upload field: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Lead Capture > Forms . Hover over the form name and click Actions , then select Edit . Hover over the file upload field and click edit Edit . In the left panel, scroll down and select the Allow multiple files check box. In the top right, click Publish . Please note: the file size limit for a file upload field is 100MB for both single and multiple file upload fields. In multiple file upload fields, there is no limit to the number of files uploaded, as long as the total size of the files is 100MB or less. To upload multiple files, select all files when choosing from the file manager. After uploading the selected files, if the Choose file button is clicked again, and another file is selected, the original files will be overwritten. It is not possible to upload multiple files one at a time. Set up a phone number form field When setting up your phone number form field, do take note of the following: Phone number settings must be customized on an individual form basis. The default phone number field only accepts numbers and characters commonly found in phone numbers such as: + - ( ) . x . If you've selected the option to Show country code dropdown menu, do note the following : The country code will be included in any number length restrictions. It is not possible to configure the default country code. By default, the country code will correspond to the visitor's device IP address. To set up your phone number form field: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Lead Capture > Forms . Hover over the form name and click Actions , then select Edit . Hover over the Phone number field and click the edit Edit . In the left panel, input a Minimum and Maximum number length. If a visitor inputs a phone number that does not meet these length restrictions, they will not be able to submit the form. To prompt visitors to select their country from a dropdown menu and include a country code, click to toggle the Show country code dropdown menu switch on. In the upper right, click Publish . Add a blog subscription field in a form It is recommended to set up and use the default blog subscription form for visitors to subscribe to your blog. If you have access to workflows, you can also create a custom checkbox field for your forms, then use a workflow to subscribe these contacts. Add the default blog subscription field to your form In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Lead Capture > Forms . Click the name of the form. In the left pane, enter Subscription in the Search box. The results will show your blog subscription properties, which will be labeled [Blog name] Email Subscription . Click and drag your blog email subscription field to the desired location in the form. In the form editor, click the email subscription field to edit its display options . In the top right, click Publish to update the live form. Add a custom blog subscription checkbox field to your form ( Professional and Enterprise only) You can create and add a custom checkbox property to your form, then use a workflow to update that property. Contacts who select the checkbox and submit the form will have their checkbox property value set as Yes . This will enroll them into the workflow and update their blog subscription property to your specified subscription frequency. Create a single checkbox contact property: Create a custom contact property and set the Field type to Single checkbox . Ensure that the Use in forms and bots option is selected. Set up a workflow to add contacts as blog subscribers: Create a contact-based workflow . Set your enrollment triggers to enroll contacts who selected the checkbox. In your workflow, click Set up triggers . In the right panel, select Contact properties . Search for and select the new subscription checkbox property . Select is any of , then click the dropdown menu and select Yes . Click the + icon to add a workflow action. In the right panel, select Set contact property value . Click the Choose a contact property dropdown menu and select [Blog name] Email Subscription property . Click the Choose property value dropdown menu and select the subscription frequency for the contact. In the upper right, click Review and publish . Review your workflow actions and settings. In the upper right, click Turn on . Add the checkbox field in your form: In your HubSpot account, navigate to Marketing > Lead Capture > Forms . Click the name of the form. In the left pane, search the name of the single checkbox contact property in the Search box. Click, drag and drop the property into the desired location in the form. In the form editor, click the field to edit its display options . In the top right, click Publish to update the live form. Forms

If you have an account-based marketing strategy , your target accounts index page is the command center for marketing and sales teams to monitor account progress. You can keep track of the accounts you or your team want to work on and quickly filter through these accounts to identify next steps. The first time you access it, you'll need to set it up by selecting a few target accounts to view in the index page. You can add more target accounts later. Add target accounts When you add a target account, you can monitor and analyze the companies' data in your target accounts index page. You can mark companies as target accounts by updating the Target account property to True . This can be done through the company index page , a company import , or via a company workflow . Otherwise, you can do it manually within your target accounts index page. To manually add target accounts: In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Companies , then click See Target Accounts . In the upper right, click Choose target accounts . In the right panel, search for the company you want to target and select the checkbox for the company. You can select as many companies as you want. Please note: these companies must have been created , before you can select them as target accounts. Once done, click Choose target accounts . The selected accounts will be added to your view. These company records will now have a Target Account property value of True . In the future, if you want to remove a target account, update their Target Account property to False in their record directly, in the relevant index pages , through an import , or via a workflow . View target account metrics Once you've added your target accounts, you can view high level metrics at the top of your target accounts index page. Target accounts: the number of target accounts in your HubSpot account. Accounts with open deals: the number of target accounts associated with deals that are not in closed-won or closed-lost deal stages . Open deal value: the sum of the Amount property values in the open deals associated with your target accounts. Missing any buying role: the number of target accounts where all associated contacts do not have a value in their Buying role property . Once an associated contact has a buyer role, the target account will not be included in the count. Missing decision makers: the number of target accounts where none of its associated contacts have the value Decision maker in their Buying role property . In the table, you can view: Contacts: the number of contacts associated with the target account. Open deals: the number of deals associated with the target account that are not in closed-won or closed-lost deal stages . Open deal value: the sum of the Amount property values in the open deals associated with your target accounts. Last touch: the period of time since a user in your HubSpot account last engaged with a contact associated with the target account. These are activities initiated by the HubSpot user, including sent 1:1 emails , calls , meetings , and LinkedIn, Whatsapp, or SMS messages. Last engagement: the period of time since a contact associated with the target account engaged with your business. These are sales activities generally initiated by the contact, such as submitting a form , viewing a document shared through the documents tool , or viewing your website . Scheduled : the next scheduled activity associated with the target account. This includes scheduled meetings , tasks , or sequence emails . Please note: if you have data privacy settings turned on in your account, the Last engagement column will not include any engagements from contacts that do not have a legal basis for processing their data . Find target accounts To identify potential accounts in your target accounts index page: Click Website visits in the left sidebar menu. To view HubSpot's recommended accounts to target based on the data in your HubSpot account, click Recommendations in the left sidebar menu. Hover over a recommended account and click Choose as target account to add them as a target account. Click Dismiss to remove the recommendation. You can also identify potential accounts among your company records by creating a score property for your companies or a workflow that helps you mark suitable companies as target accounts based on their property values. Filter and view your target accounts In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Companies , then click See Target Accounts . To filter the target accounts to a specific company owner or team, click the All owners or Select teams dropdown menus at the top of the page. To filter the target accounts for a better high-level overview, click a category in the left sidebar menu: All: this shows you all your target accounts. Blockers: this shows you all target accounts that are associated with contacts whose Buying role property value is Blocker . No decision maker: this shows you all target accounts that are not associated with a contact whose Buying role property value is Decision maker . No logged calls: this shows you all target accounts that never had a logged call. No meetings: this shows you all target accounts that never had a logged meeting. No open deals: this shows you all target accounts without any open deals (i.e., deals that are not closed-lost or closed won). Learn more about deal pipelines . No open tasks: this shows you all target accounts that do not have any open tasks to complete. View a target account's overview All users can see the Account overview on a high level in the right panel of a company record . If you're a user with a Sales Hub Professional or Enterprise seat , you can access the full Account overview . In your HubSpot account, navigate to CRM > Companies , then click See Target Accounts . If you don't have a Sales Hub Professional or Enterprise seat , click the name to be directed to its company record in a new tab. If you have a Sales Hub Professional or Enterprise seat , click the name to view the Account overview in the right panel. This includes: activities associated with the company; associated contacts for which the company is their primary company association ; Please note: if there's a discrepancy between the number of contacts shown on the target accounts index page compared to a company's Account overview , it's because the Contacts column displays all associated contacts, while the Account overview panel displays contacts only if the company is set as their primary company. internal stakeholders, which are HubSpot users who have created or been part of activities associated with the company; deals associated with the company; and tracked page views from associated contacts. Work with a target account To work on a target account, hover over the target account and click Actions : Create task: select to create a task for the target account in its company record in a new tab. Create note: select to create a note for the target account in its company record in a new tab. View company record: select to open the company record in a new tab. Remove account : select to remove the company as a target account. In the dialog box, click Remove to confirm. CRM records

titulo: Diretório de soluções da HubSpot | Perguntas frequentes
conteudo: Abaixo, você encontrará respostas a perguntas frequentes sobre a configuração de um perfil de diretório e como usar seu perfil assim que ele for configurado. Configurar o perfil da sua empresa Como faço para publicar meu perfil? Ainda tem problemas para criar seu perfil? Envie um tíquete de ajuda abaixo. Como usar o diretório O diretório é gratuito? Por que eu tenho que ser certificado em inbound? Publiquei ou alterei meu perfil. Porque eu não vejo ele ativo? Posso usar duas URLs diferentes em meu perfil: uma para o CTA de contato e outro para a URL do site? Minha empresa tem dois ou vários escritórios no país/mundo. Posso listar minha empresa em várias localidades? Como funcionam as revisões? Como posso gerenciar notificações para revisões? Como faço para responder a revisões? Como faço para adicionar um emblema de revisão do Diretório de Soluções ao meu site? Onde estão meus estudos de caso? Como a classificação funciona? O diretório está localizado para falantes de idiomas diferentes do inglês? Como faço para publicar meu perfil? Você pode criar seu perfil para o Diretório de Soluções seguindo essas instruções . O diretório é gratuito? Sim. Todas as empresas certificadas em inbound podem ser listadas no Diretório de Soluções gratuitamente. Por que eu tenho que ser certificado em inbound? A certificação é necessária para garantir que sua empresa seja equipada com serviços de inbound de qualidade para seus clientes. A Certificação em Inbound oferece essa metodologia. Publiquei ou alterei meu perfil. Porque eu não vejo ele ativo? Uma sincronização noturna precisa ocorrer antes que novos perfis apareçam ou antes que as alterações sejam refletidas em seu perfil existente. Aguarde 24 horas antes de procurar seu novo perfil ou o perfil atualizado. Posso usar duas URLs diferentes em meu perfil: uma para o CTA de contato e outro para a URL do site? Não nesse momento. A mesma URL é usada para ambos os links. Você também pode usar um link personalizado que leva os visitantes a uma página personalizada em seu site. Minha empresa tem dois ou vários escritórios no país/mundo. Posso listar minha empresa em várias localidades? Sim, você pode listar até cinco localizações de escritório ou até cinco localizações remotas. Como funcionam as revisões? Saiba mais sobre como sair de uma revisão e diretrizes de revisão . Um revisor deve estar conectado à sua conta da HubSpot para enviar uma revisão. Como posso gerenciar notificações para revisões? Usuários em uma conta da HubSpot com um perfil de diretório são optados para receber notificações sobre novas revisões ou revisões que são removidas automaticamente. Um usuário individual pode personalizar suas notificações no Centro de Notificações na seção Geral . Como faço para responder a revisões? Saiba mais sobre responder a revisões no perfil do Diretório de soluções . Como faço para adicionar um emblema de revisão do Diretório de Soluções ao meu site Um emblema de revisão é uma imagem pré-projetada com um hiperlink que pode ser adicionada ao seu site para ajudar a direcionar o tráfego para o perfil de diretório da sua agência. Saiba mais sobre como adicionar um emblema de revisão ao seu site . Onde estão meus estudos de caso? Embora você possa usar estudos de caso em sua conta do HubSpot, por enquanto, eles não estarão ativos em sua página de perfil. Como a classificação funciona? Os parceiros da HubSpot ganham níveis dependendo do sucesso que eles conseguiram para os clientes com o inbound marketing ou vendas, além do software da HubSpot. Os níveis vão de elite (maior) até gold. Os parceiros sem classificação (e empresas que não são parceiras da HubSpot) aparecem depois dos parceiros classificados. O diretório está localizado para falantes de idiomas diferentes do inglês? Sim. O diretório está disponível atualmente em espanhol , francês , alemão , japonês e português . Ainda tem problemas para criar seu perfil? Se ainda tiver problemas para criar seu perfil, entre em contato com o suporte . Partner Tools

titulo: Compreender os campos de formulário pré-populados
conteudo: Por defeito, os campos do formulário HubSpot serão preenchidos com dados de visitantes previamente submetidos. Pode desligar isto usando a opção Pre-popular campos com valores conhecidos ao configurar o seu formulário. Quando um visitante chega a um formulário da HubSpot, o HubSpot verifica o navegador dele para rastrear cookies. Se este cookie estiver associado a um contacto, o HubSpot poderá pré-popular campos que tenham sido previamente submetidos nesse dispositivo. Se estiver a utilizar a ferramenta Reuniões, saiba mais sobre quando os campos do formulário de reuniões irão pré-popular com as informações de um contacto . Requisitos para campos de formulário de pré-população Para que o HubSpot possa pré-popular os campos de formulário, todas as condições abaixo devem ser satisfeitas: Os campos de Pré-população com opção de valores conhecidos devem ser alternados. Isto é activado por defeito quando se criam novos formulários. O visitante submeteu previamente um formulário HubSpot usando o mesmo dispositivo. HubSpot apenas pré-populará dados previamente submetidos a um formulário HubSpot no mesmo dispositivo. Por exemplo, se submeter o seu número de telefone a um formulário no seu ambiente de trabalho, mas o número for actualizado a partir de um registo de contacto no HubSpot ou outro formulário submetido a partir do seu dispositivo móvel, a propriedade actualizada não será pré-populada em nenhum formulário no seu ambiente de trabalho. Apenas será exibido o número de telefone da apresentação anterior. O visitante submeteu previamente um formulário HubSpot no mesmo sítio rastreado. Se a página de partilha de um formulário for utilizada, o visitante deve ter previamente submetido um formulário no mesmo domínio share.hsforms.com . Questões comuns de campo de formulários pré-populados Apresentamos a seguir algumas questões comuns de forma pré-populosa que poderá encontrar e os passos típicos para a sua resolução. Edição Causa Passos para resolver a questão A informação de outra pessoa está a pré-popular-me ou os campos do meu formulário de contacto. Se outra pessoa tiver utilizado previamente o seu navegador e dispositivo para enviar um formulário, a informação deles substituirá a sua. Quando voltar a visitar o mesmo formulário, a sua informação aparecerá no seu lugar. Se você ou os seus contactos notarem a informação de outra pessoa pré-popular os seus campos do formulário, há duas opções: Pode limpar os cookies do seu browser e voltar a enviar o seu formulário para associar o seu browser a um novo cookie de rastreio. Pode adicionar um link para os utilizadores redefinirem o seu formulário nas suas opções de formulário. Clicando neste link, o formulário será reinicializado e o rastreio de cookies será desligado na submissão do formulário , o que evita qualquer sobreposição de cookies . Os valores pré-seleccionados do meu campo do formulário estão a ser sobreescritos. Se optou por pré-popular os seus campos de formulário: Os valores pré-seleccionados serão sobrescritos por valores conhecidos Os valores por defeito não serão sobregravados por valores conhecidos. Para submeter um valor específico enquanto pré-popula os campos do seu formulário, utilize um tipo de propriedade com um valor por defeito em vez de um valor pré-seleccionado. Saiba mais sobre a utilização de valores por defeito ou valores pré-seleccionados com esta opção . Forms

titulo: Canadian indirect taxes | Frequently asked questions
conteudo: Please note: this article has been prepared for informational purposes only. It is not intended to provide, and should not be relied on as tax advice. For any questions you should consult your own tax and/or legal advisors. If you’re a HubSpot customer in Canada, learn how HubSpot handles indirect taxes per province and territory, and how you can update HubSpot with your tax information. Which indirect taxes does HubSpot collect from Canadian customers? Depending on your province or territory, HubSpot may need to collect Goods and Services Tax (GST), Harmonized Sales Tax (HST), Provincial Sales Tax (PST), or Quebec Sales Tax (QST). Goods and Services tax: as of July 1, 2021 , HubSpot began charging GST. This tax generally applies to goods and/or services that are sold and supplied into Canada. This includes intangible personal property such as trademarks, rights to use a patent, and digitized products. GST is separate and in addition to the provincial level sales tax (PST), on most goods and services that are bought and sold for use or consumption within Canada. Generally, GST is invoiced by the supplier of goods or services, then collected from the customer, and remitted to the tax authorities. Learn more about GST . Harmonized Sales Tax: as of July 1, 2021 , HubSpot began charging HST. This tax includes both the federal GST and any additional provincial sales tax that has been combined with the federal GST. HST applies only to participating provinces in Canada. Generally, HST applies to the same base of property (i.e., tangible and intangible) and services as GST, however at a different rate. The HST rate can vary from one participating province to another. Learn more about HST . Provincial Sales Tax: as of April 1, 2021 , HubSpot began charging PST. This tax is generally due when goods and/or services are sold and supplied into British Columbia and Saskatchewan. PST is separate and in addition to the GST. Generally, PST is invoiced by the supplier of goods or services, then collected from the customer, and remitted to the tax authorities. The PST imposed by British Columbia and Saskatchewan is not a recoverable tax. Learn more about PST for British Columbia and Saskatchewan . Quebec Sales Tax: as of July 1, 2021 , HubSpot began charging QST. This tax generally applies to goods and/or services that are sold and supplied into Quebec. This includes intangible personal property such as trademarks, rights to use a patent, and digitized products. QST is separate and in addition to the goods and services tax (GST), on most goods and services that are bought and sold for use or consumption within Quebec. Generally, QST is invoiced by the supplier of goods or services, then collected from the customer, and remitted to the tax authorities. Learn more about QST . The GST/HST and QST imposed by Canada is a recoverable tax. GST/HST and QST registrants can generally claim an input tax credit (ITC) on those taxes incurred in the course of a commercial activity. In other words, GST/HST and QST is usually not a net cost to registered businesses. For more specifics on the recoverability of GST/HST and QST charged by HubSpot, please speak to your tax advisor. Who is liable to pay GST/HST/PST/QST in Canada? HubSpot will collect indirect taxes on all customers whose shipping address is located in Canada. Learn how to check what your primary company address is set to in HubSpot . Some exemptions may be applicable, such as the sale to First National individuals or bands. There are no exemptions available from indirect taxes applicable for charities. However, depending on their status, charities may be allowed to reclaim from the government a part of the GST/HST paid on their expenses. Some exemptions for PST may be applicable, such as the sale for resale. Please note: if you purchased HubSpot before July 1st, 2021 and you upgrade your account after that date, you will be charged tax on the pro-rated amount. For example, if you purchased a one-year Sales Starter subscription on June 1st, 2021 and purchased an additional Sales Starter seat on November 1st, 2021, you will be charged tax for both Sales Starter and the additional seat from November 1st, 2021 through May 31st, 2022. Why is there a GST/HST/PST/QST charge on my HubSpot invoice? HubSpot is required to collect and remit GST/HST/PST/QST for customers who are located in Canada. What if I have a GST/HST/PST/QST exemption and forget to provide it? Generally, GST/HST/PST/QST will be applied to all invoices where the exemption has not been provided in a timely manner. If you can provide a valid exemption covering the service period, please submit the proper supporting documents to billing@hubspot.com . The deadlines for providing supporting documentation are as follows: GST/HST/QST exemptions: submit your information within 30 days of the invoice issuance date. PST exemptions: submit your PST ID or exemption certificate within 180 days (British Columbia) or 30 days (Saskatchewan) of the invoice issuance date. What are HubSpot's Canadian indirect tax account numbers? GST/HST: 793763004RT0001 QST: 1228655623 TQ 001 BC PST: PST-1458-1309 Are there any GST/HST or QST obligations for me as a customer? No. If you want to claim an input tax credit for the GST/HST paid to HubSpot, ensure that you keep a copy of HubSpot’s invoice for your records. Why is the PST ID section blank on my invoice? The PST ID section will only have a value if you're a tax exempt customer. If you're not a tax exempt customer, you don't need to provide HubSpot with a PST ID and you may disregard this section. billing

Depois de publicar seu podcast , analise o desempenho do seu podcast usando relatórios de podcast. Você pode revisar o desempenho geral do programa, os principais episódios do podcast e muito mais. Observação: os dados de análises do podcast estarão disponíveis somente para podcasts publicados após 15 de agosto de 2024. Revisar os relatórios de podcast Para revisar relatórios de podcast: Na sua conta da HubSpot, acesse Conteúdo > Podcasts . No canto superior esquerdo, clique no menu suspenso Programa de podcast e selecione um podcast . Na parte superior, clique na guia Analisar . No canto superior esquerdo, configure seus relatórios: Intervalo de datas: filtre os dados de desempenho do podcast por intervalo de datas. Ao filtrar por intervalo de datas, os dados se basearão nas datas em que o podcast foi ouvido. Frequência : defina a frequência dos dados do podcast para diária, mensal ou semanal. Revise os seguintes relatórios de podcast: Mostrar desempenho: o desempenho geral do podcast ao longo do tempo. Este relatório exibirá o número de reproduções para páginas da HubSpot e plataformas externas com base na frequência definida nos filtros do relatório. Principais episódios: os principais episódios do podcast por número de reproduções. Isso não leva em consideração ouvintes únicos. Reproduções de site por país: a contagem e a porcentagem de reproduções de site pelo país do ouvinte. Não inclui reproduções por plataformas externas, como Spotify ou podcasts da Apple. Reproduções de site por dispositivo: a contagem e a porcentagem de reproduções de site por dispositivo, como dispositivos móveis ou computadores. Não inclui reproduções por plataformas externas, como Spotify ou podcasts da Apple. Site reproduzido por página: a contagem de reproduções de sites nas páginas do HubSpot. Não inclui reproduções por plataformas externas, como Spotify ou podcasts da Apple. Ouvintes do site: o número de ouvintes conhecidos do seu podcast. Este relatório incluirá apenas reproduções por contatos conhecidos, o que pode exigir consentimento para rastrear se o banner de cookies estiver habilitado. Reproduções externas: a contagem de reproduções e downloads por meio de qualquer outro aplicativo ou plataforma de podcast, como Spotify ou podcasts da Appel ao longo do tempo. Ações externas por plataforma: o número de ações externas por plataforma. Observação: Você pode notar uma discrepância entre as execuções do site e as métricas dos ouvintes do site. O número de reproduções de site inclui visitantes desconhecidos e contatos conhecidos, enquanto o número de ouvintes de site incluirá apenas contatos conhecidos. Você pode notar discrepâncias entre os dados das análises Spotify e HubSpot. Os episódios de podcast são armazenados em cache no Spotify, o que pode impedir que as peças sejam exibidas nas análises do HubSpot. O número de reproduções no HubSpot pode parecer menor do que no aplicativo Spotify. Salvar ou exportar dados de relatório do podcast Você pode salvar ou exportar dados de relatório: Na sua conta da HubSpot, vá para Conteúdo > Podcasts . No canto superior esquerdo, clique no menu suspenso Programa de podcast e selecione um podcast . Na parte superior, clique na guia Analisar . Para salvar um relatório na ferramenta de relatórios: No canto superior esquerdo, clique em Ações . Em seguida, selecione Salvar relatório . Insira o nome de uma equipe . Insira uma descrição do relatório . Selecione o botão de opção para confirmar se deseja adicionar o relatório a um painel: Não adicionar ao painel : o HubSpot não adicionará o relatório aos painéis, mas o salvará na sua biblioteca de relatórios para que você possa usá-lo posteriormente. Adicionar ao painel existente: você pode selecionar um painel existente para adicionar o relatório. Adicionar ao novo painel: você pode criar um novo painel personalizado e adicionar o relatório social ao novo painel. Clique em próximo , insira um nome e selecione uma opção de visibilidade . Clique em Salvar ou Salvar e adicionar se você escolheu adicionar o relatório a um painel. Para exportar dados do relatório externamente: No canto superior esquerdo, clique em Ações . Em seguida, clique em Exportar . Na caixa de diálogo, insira o nome da exportação . Clique no menu suspenso formato de arquivo e selecione csv , xls ou xlsx . No canto inferior, clique em Exportar . O arquivo de exportação será enviado por e-mail ao seu endereço de e-mail de usuário. Files

Saiba mais sobre cada uma das ações que você pode usar para construir uma conversa de bot . Você também pode personalizar cada ação do bot usando lógica condicional para criar uma experiência interativa para os visitantes do seu site. Para adicionar novas ações ao seu bot: Na sua conta HubSpot, acesse Automações > Fluxos de chat .
